text: Elkin Fernando Ramírez Zapata (26 October 1962 - 29 January 2017) was a Colombian singer-songwriter. He was best known as the lead singer of the rock band Kraken. He was also a member to bands such as Kripzy (1981-1982) and Ferrotrack (1983-1984). He joined Kraken in 1985. He was born in Medellín, Antioquia. Ramírez died from brain cancer on 29 January 2017 in Medellín.
